intro: Yasunia quadrata, commonly known as the four-angled yasunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its square stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Yasunia quadrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
